text: Eliphaz’s Response Continues
“Call now, is there \add anyone\add* answering you?
And to which of \add the\add* holy ones will you turn?
For vexation will slay the fool,
and jealousy will kill \add the\add* simple.
I have seen a fool taking root,
but\f + \fr 5:3 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* suddenly I cursed his dwelling.
His children are far from deliverance,
and they are crushed in the gate,
and there is no deliverer—
whose harvest \add the\add* hungry eats,
and he takes it ⸤from behind⸥\f + \fr 5:5 \ft Literally “to from” \f* \add the\add* thorns;
and \add the\add* thirsty pants after their wealth.
Indeed,\f + \fr 5:6 \ft Or “For” \f* mischief does not come from the dust,
and trouble does not sprout from the earth.
But a human being is born to trouble,
and ⸤they soar aloft⸥\f + \fr 5:7 \ft Literally “they make high to fly” \f* \add like\add* ⸤sparks⸥.\f + \fr 5:7 \ft Literally “children of flame” \f*
“But I myself\f + \fr 5:8 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* will seek God,
and to God I would commit my cause.
\add He\add* is doing great and ⸤unsearchable⸥\f + \fr 5:9 \ft Literally “there is no searching” \f* things,
marvelous things ⸤without number⸥\f + \fr 5:9 \ft Literally “until there is no number” \f*—
the one who is giving rain on \add the\add* ⸤surface of⸥\f + \fr 5:10 \ft Literally “faces of” \f* \add the\add* earth
and is sending water on \add the\add* ⸤surface of⸥\f + \fr 5:10 \ft Literally “faces of” \f* \add the\add* fields,
to set \add the\add* lowly on high,
and \add those\add* mourning are lifted to safety.
\add He\add* is frustrating \add the\add* devices of \add the\add* crafty,
and their hands do not achieve success.
\add He\add* is capturing \add the\add* wise in their craftiness,
and the schemes of the wily are rushed.
In the daytime they meet \add with\add* darkness,
and they grope at noon\f + \fr 5:14 \ft Or “the noon” \f* as \add in\add* the night.
And\f + \fr 5:15 \ft Or “Thus,” or “So” \f* he saves from the sword of\f + \fr 5:15 \ft Literally “from” \f* their mouth,

⸤even⸥\f + \fr 5:15 \ft Literally “and”; the entire verse could be translated “So he saves the poor from \fq the \ft sword of their mouth and from the hand of the strong” \f* \add the\add* poor from the hand of the strong.
So\f + \fr 5:16 \ft Or “And” \f* there is hope\f + \fr 5:16 \ft Or “hope exists” \f* for the powerless,
and wickedness shuts its mouth.
“Look, happy \add is the\add* human being whom God reproves;
and you must not despise the discipline of Shaddai,
for he himself\f + \fr 5:18 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* wounds, but\f + \fr 5:18 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he binds up;
he strikes, but\f + \fr 5:18 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* his hands heal.
⸤From⸥\f + \fr 5:19 \ft Literally “In,” or “By” \f* six troubles he will deliver you,
and in seven evil shall not touch you.
In famine he will redeem you from death,
and in war from \add the\add* ⸤power of⸥\f + \fr 5:20 \ft Literally “hand of” \f* \add the\add* sword.
From \add the\add* scourge of \add the\add* tongue you shall be hidden,
and you shall not be afraid of\f + \fr 5:21 \ft Hebrew “from” \f* destruction when it comes.
At destruction and famine\f + \fr 5:22 \ft Hebrew “at famine” \f* you shall laugh,
and you shall not fear the wild animals of the earth.
For your covenant \add will be\add* with the stones of the field,
and the wild animals\f + \fr 5:23 \ft Collective singular \f* of the field will be at peace with you.
And you shall know that your tent \add is\add* safe,
and you will inspect your fold, and you shall not be missing \add anything\add*.
And you shall know that your offspring \add are\add* many,
and your descendants like the vegetation of the earth.
You shall come in maturity to \add the\add* grave,
as the raising up of a stack of sheaves in its season.
“Look, we have searched this out—it \add is\add* true;
hear it and know \add it\add* ⸤yourself⸥.”\f + \fr 5:27 \ft Literally “you for yourself” \f*
